body.name: PowerXL Power AirFryer 5.3 Quart Deluxe with Cookbook

features: ENJOY FRIED FOODS WITHOUT THE GUILT! - The amazing way to fry foods with little to no oil using super-heated air, less fat & up to 80% fewer calories - Cook healthier with less added fat!

FEATURES - 1700 Watts of Turbo-Cyclonic Power - 5.3 Quart Easy-Load Basket With - Non-Stick Coating with Divider - 5.3 Quart Easy-Load Basket With - Non-Stick Coating with Divider - One-Touch Easy Digital Controls - 7 Preset Programs - Digital Timer With Automatic Shut Off - Super-Heated Air Heats Up To 400° - Cool To The Touch - Easy-Grip Handle - EZ To Follow Step-By-Step Recipe Book.

USEFUL BONUS OF A HEAVY DUTY UTILITY TONG - Heavy-duty stainless steel construction utility tong, Secure grip for front and back of house operations, Mirror finish - Spring-loaded construction - Scalloped edges for easy grabbing.

BEST FRYING EXPERIENCE - Frying your favorite foods has never been easier with the Power Air Fryer XL. It’s virtually goof-proof. Simply add your food to the Easy Load basket, slide it into the unit, and with the touch of a finger select your cooking setting from one of the 7 preset programs. The digital touch panel display eliminates the guesswork and ensures whatever your cooking comes out perfectly delicious time after time.

CONVENIENCE - It does all the thinking for you, and when the timer is done, the automatic shut-off stops the cooking cycle so you never overcook or burn your meal. You’ll love the versatility of this 6 in 1 kitchen wonder. It Air Fries, Bakes, Steams, Sautés, Grills and Roasts. The amazing turbo-cyclonic super-heated air powered by 1700 watts reaches up to 400 degrees in a matter of seconds.
body.description: The secret to the Power AirFryer XL is Rapid Air Technology. The Power AirFryer XL surrounds your food with Turbo Cyclonic Air instead of oil. Your meals are cooked in a whirlwind of superheated air, not oil or lard. That means any of your favorite fast foods can be made with fewer calories from added cooking fat/oil, without sacrificing taste. You get the same, crispy fried taste & texture you love. With little to no oil, no trans fats, and no greasy mess! The best part is the state-of-the-art digital touchscreen & 7 one-touch easy pre-sets for French fries, chicken, steak, roasts, shrimp & baked goods. Making your favorite waffle fries from childhood? Just press the French Fries button, and the Power AirFryer XL does the rest!, Hardcover Cookbook;Baking Pan;Pizza Pan

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works great and love that the basket comes out so can dump food old one did not.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than pan frying or baking
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the Power Air Fryer XL kind of on a whim. I watched the infomercial and I was hooked. When it came, it was a bit intimidating, but after reading the instructions, the recipe book, and watching some youtube videos I felt I had a handle on it.It's very easy to use once you get a handle on the menu button. There are preset time/temp for certain foods or you can manually set the time and temp. I've fixed mostly chicken (legs, thighs, breasts, wings) and the key is turning the chicken. The first time I air fried the chicken, I didn't turn it, and the coating was odd. The next time, I turned it about every 10 minutes or so and it was perfect. It saves on oil and time cleaning up the mess. We made chicken wings and they were better than a deep fryer and/or oven. They were awesome.Here are the things we noticed that you might want to be aware of 1) when air frying something with a lot of fat (thighs, ect) the unit will smoke. You just have to pull out the basket, drain the grease and put it back in. It's a pain, but the results are awesome. We made a batch of thighs and had to drain the grease twice, we made a batch of legs and didn't have to drain it at all. 2) you will need to season your meat more. Since you are getting the flavor from the oil, the "taste" of whatever your air frying might be a little bland. We just use more seasonings and that works for us.Other than those two little issues, we love it. It's a breeze to clean and seems much faster than baking or even pan frying.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Love this air fryer it is absolutely amazing. It cooks and heat up anything.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tasty and moist food, easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Very easy to use. A plethora of recipes online. Cookbook had a number of very interesting recipes. The sandwich section was of particular interest. Clean up was a snap. Foot print (area used by cooker) is fairly small compared to the big George that I'm replacing with this unit. I like the 5.3 quart size sine it will hold a medium size chicken or a turkey breast. The food that we've cooked so far in it came out moist, tasty and was done much quicker than the oven.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Power Air Fryer XL
reviews.reviewText: I used this item once when I tried to use it 2 days later it will not come on. So there is nothing to like about it. Is it worth the price NO. Yes it worked the first time with no problem. But I can't be satisfied with this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Love it. Just the right size for me. Use very little oil instead of massive amounts. Doesn’t heat up the house.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love my air fryer
reviews.reviewText: My air fryer cooks great. I love that its easy to clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Seems like a factory reject or outlet quality. Has some chips in the plastic shell and it's hard to slide back in sometimes like it doesn't quite fit together right or was damaged in some way. If you can get the basket in it heats up really hot and fast though and it has great capacity so I'm going to keep it.
